sentence.text: The aim of this study was to examine the mitotic spindle organization expression and its role in tumor progression, invasion and metastasis in squamous cell carcinoma of the oral tongue (SCCOT).
Immunohistochemistry was used to observe the mitotic spindle organization expression and its correlation with clinicopathologic factors in oral tongue cancer.

The immunohistochemistry showed that mitotic spindle organization expression was stronger in oral tongue cancer tissues than in paired adjacent tissues (PAAAA0.01), and the higher expression of mitotic spindle organization was also significantly associated with lymph node metastasis (PAAAA0.01), tumor clinical stage (PAAAA0.01).
